meanings.definition: Relating to the physical features of a region or terrain.
meanings.sent1: The map displayed the physiographical details of the mountain range.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the physiographical changes caused by erosion.
meanings.sent3: The physiographical puzzle of the shifting sands kept the researchers intrigued.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a physiographical map, with valleys of memories and peaks of aspirations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the physiographical essence of the coastal cliffs.

meanings.definition: Describing the natural characteristics of a landscape.
meanings.sent1: The guide provided a physiographical overview of the national park.
meanings.sent2: The photographer aimed to capture the unique physiographical beauty of the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The physiographical charm of the forest enchanted all who visited.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a physiographical depth, reflecting the hues of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The writer's words painted a vivid picture of the physiographical wonders of the valley.
